name: Thistle City Barbican

reviews.text: Was attending an event at the Barbican (10 -12 minutes walk away) so I was booked in by the event's organisers as part of a group. The room and breakfast were satisfactory and the staff in the restaurant were pleasant. The breakfast was standard fair but getting hot tea proved a challenge. One of our group had a room on the 6th floor which was rather poor. Overall I would rate this as an average 3 star hotel.
reviews.title: One of those hoteles with variable standards of room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked a last minute weekend break here at a reduced price. The room was an adequate size, furnishings not as modern as the rest of the hotel and view was of the inside walls! The rest of the hotel was very nice, good breakfast with loads of choice and well cooked. We ordered room service which wasn't too pricey and the food was ok. Location wise it was around 15 mins walk to the tube, slightly dodgy areas around! We didn't use the spa but we had a quick peek and it looked very nice with decent opening hours. All in all a great hotel if you don't want to pay the high prices for other London hotels.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, bit out of the way

reviews.text: London is really expensive for accommodation. If one finds a modest priced B & B, there will lmost often be a question of cleanliness and service.
reviews.title: Good London hotel in not veryinteresting location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found Thistle Barbican offer through Daily Mail. It was 55 GBP per night for a twin room which works well for myself, my husband and daughter.
reviews.title: Ok for one night.

reviews.text: It took us just over 1 hour by London Underground from London Heathrow to Old St. station with a change of line at King's Cross. I gooled map the walking instruction and that was very helpful. Google said it was about 12 mins walk, but I walk slow plus pulling a heavy suitcase did not help. It took me perhaps nearly 20 mins to walk. My husband and daughter walked way in front of me all the time. lol!
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: I stayed at the Thistle Barbicon on Saturday eveing. When I checked in I got my room key and proceeded to a room 2235 which was like a prison cell. Basic beyond words and literaly a single bed with walls around it. The handle to my door came off when I triued to open the door. There was load voices in the hall all night long. Terrible experience!!! Rooms like that should never be sold. In any other part of the world a single room is the same size just a different cost. This room was the size of a walk in closet.
reviews.title: Worst room ever

reviews.text: For a London hotel its quite nice but pricey.
reviews.title: Good London Hotel

reviews.text: The rooms are nice as are the communal areas but breakfast felt rushed and busy. Food was good though.
reviews.title: Average.

reviews.text: Location isnt great to be honest, nearest tube is Old Street a good 15 minute walk away and the neighbourhood didnt feel that great!
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.text: Overall pretty decent place that I've stayed at a few times now so can't be too bad!
reviews.title: Disappointing for the Price.

reviews.text: Having read previous reviews I was a bit concerned about what I would find but on arrival we soon realised our fears were unfounded(can I trust trip advisor). The room was great and every member of staff without exception were courteous and helpful.the walk to Old st tube was 8mins tops and as we had oyster cards we used the tube a lot . London was great so was the hotel
reviews.title: Really enjoyed my stay

reviews.text: I only stayed at the hotel for one night ,but I found the room to be very clean,the bathroom was excellent good towels. The bed linen I found was very clean although I found the pillows to be a bit on the hard side but overall the standard of the room was excellent . I did eat in the restraunt which was good but found an excellent eatery across the road in the small parade of shops called FISH CENTRAL the stafff ,food ,portion size and price was simply brilliant. When next in London I will surely stay in this hotel and eat at Fish Central.
reviews.title: A great stay

reviews.text: The staff are really friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Old and Tired bedrooms

reviews.text: The appearance of the common areas is pretty good.
reviews.title: Tired and in need of refurb

reviews.text: The bedrooms and bathrooms are very tired and depressing.
reviews.title: For business, forget it
Not in the Barbican, tired grotty
reviews.text: This hotel is in Clerkenwell, not Barbican, in an area I would not walk through at night. Travelling as a woman alone I was put in the "annexe" over the way from the main building. There is no reception desk or security, anyone could walk in and a tiny lift takes you to a floor with narrow corridors with many dark corners. The paint is scuffed battleship grey.When I got in the first floor room at midnight after an evening out the window was wide open on to a flat roof outside. The window had no lock. I travel a lot on business and have felt unsafe before. To their credit the staff gave me another room in the main building.
The rooms are so tired the silver has worn off the taps down to the brass underneath, and the decor is pure 1980's.and it didn't feel very clean. There are better value hotels that ARE in the City.
reviews.title: Variable Rooms & Variable Pricing

reviews.text: I stayed here on business in early May 2013, checked in for one night and had a reasonable stay in a reasonable room. The room rate was around 130 GBP for the night without breakfast.
reviews.title: Smallest room I've every paid $300 to stay in

reviews.text: My room was "ok". Nothing that I'd write home about but nothing that I'd complain about. The staff at the hotel were friendly but the restaurant/bar looked a bit too "corporate" to me.
reviews.title: Dated hotel with leisure facilities only redeeming feature

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Later in May,I returned to spend another two nights. My room rate was slightly higher at around 150 GBP per night.
reviews.title: Deserves a better rating

reviews.text: Stayed here on business for a week. The rooms are clean and quiet but are basic and could do with some maintenance. Had a number of minor issues with the room. I stayed in the annex opposite the main building and am not sure if the rooms are better in the main building.
reviews.title: Clean and quiet hotel in need of a makeover

reviews.text: My heart sank when I read some of the reviews on here about this hotel - I get no choice where work books me in to. I have to say though that I have stayed here twice now and have absolutely no issues with the hotel at all. The staff have been friendly and courteous, even when I checked in after a business dinner and was a little bit wobbly! The rooms have been nice enough for a central London hotel, no issues with them. Breakfast has been most pleasing on both occasions, although they failed to deliver me a newspaper on either occasion. That said, there were complimentary copies of the FT in the lobby area so no great hardship.
reviews.title: Excellent business hotel

reviews.text: All in all a most acceptable business hotel that I would quite happiliy use for a short leisure stay as well. Iwish it was a little closer to a tube station though.
reviews.title: A clean, quiet & convenient place to lay your head

reviews.text: I was nervous about some of the reviews for this hotel, but we booked the room as part of a train & theatre package and were not disappointed.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.text: We were in the main building, overlooking Lever Street, but we were not disturbed by any traffic noise. The room decor was a little tired, but it was spotlessly clean (we even came up from breakfast at 9.30 am to find our room being cleaned!) and the beds were comfortable. My only tiny gripe is that the room was a little on the chilly side (it was an icy weekend) & we could not get the ac/heater to warm it up at all. The bedclothes were warm enough though!
reviews.title: realy disappointed this time

reviews.text: For £130 room only having now stayed its not quite the deal I thought it was. It's a bit of a walk to the tube and not very central at all.
reviews.title: Expensive but would stop again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But all in all the staff were very friendly.
reviews.title: Ticked most of our boxes!

reviews.text: The previous occupant of our room had obviously been smoking and when this was raised with reception they did offer us another room which was good service.
reviews.title: Expensive for location

reviews.text: The fish restaurant opposite the hotel on the main road was really good. Doesn't look like much but don't let this put you off, the food was great!
reviews.title: Thistle - should be thorn.
Family stay
reviews.text: Also! Don't pay for brekky at the hotel at £12 each! if you're happy to go the cafe (looks like a kebab shop on the outside) opposite the main entrance for around £4.50 each including toast and a brew! Was freshly cooked and the best we've had in a long time :)

Room was the size of a box for 2 people, was extremely hot due to pipes running through the room with no window opening allowed. Hairs were left in the bath, walls are very thin so can hear everything that goes on we strangle even had an in connecting door to another room with a standard lock that if pushed you could probably break in. I wouldn't choose to stay here again unless I really had too I would say its on the same budget as etap!!
reviews.title: Middle of a council estate

reviews.text: Difficult to find much to recommend in this hotel apart from smiles at reception desk. For GBP 180 a night you do much better (GBP 100 a night buys you a night in the Premiere Inn in the City).
reviews.title: 2.5 Stars Not 3 Stars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms were long overdue for refurbishment and small to boot. Bed was about 90 cms wide but pillows were of good quality. London has never been good value but this was definitely below par.
reviews.title: A comfortable Base in London

reviews.text: If you are looking to see the sights of London for a few nights you could do much worse than this hotel. The rooms are smallish but adequate, the breakfast choice is good and the service friendly and helpful. We booked it through Superbreak and had never stayed here before. We could criticise its location as it is at least 10 mins from any tube station without any local attractions to visit. However, it offers very good value for money in this expensive city.
reviews.title: Poor hotel, max. 3*

reviews.text: The hotel hard to find and quite a distant walk from the metro station. Has two buildings: one where you can live, have breakfast and go directly to sauna and other that you have to get through outside. I am not sure how much the rooms are better in the first building, but I stayed at the other one, where rooms are to the street (the one little window in the room opened american style and an impression was that ir is always a bit open - noise and cold incomming). Except for the lobby, the room was run down, very little, no mini bar, only one draw for clothes. Had a safe and ironing stuff. I was told it was 4 star, but I would give only 3. No slippers! :) and robes are only in suits, but I managed to get one - although no point to use it if you don't have a straight way to the basement pool (havent cheked that). Overall the staff was helpfull (although I needed a standard mini usb to usb cable and they could not get me one). Breakfast poor.
reviews.title: Warning! - Groups treated as second class citizens

reviews.text: I was here for 2 weeks from late April to early May 2013.
reviews.title: Good hotel, free wifi

reviews.text: The early check in was quite OK.

description: Within walking distance from Old Street and Barbican tube stations the Thistle City Barbican provides easy access to the whole of London and its many attractions. We have convenient transport links for King’s Cross & Liverpool Street National Rail as well as St Pancras International station for Eurostar.Ideally located on the edge of the City of London, with the financial district just minutes away, we are also in a prime location for business travellers. Our dedicated conference facilities with 13 flexible meeting rooms will cater for business meetings, corporate special events, private dining and banquets for up to 170 delegates.Inclusive with your hotel booking you can enjoy the Otium Health & Leisure Club to work out, for a refreshing swim or simply relax and de-stress in the Jacuzzi, Sauna and Steam room. Whether you are here for business or leisure our Otium Health & Leisure Club has all you need to make your experience complete.Thistle City Barbican Hotel features 463 bedrooms including Standard, Deluxe and Family rooms as well as Suites. All of our guestrooms, meeting rooms and public areas are equipped with BT Openzone Wi-Fi internet access. For guests travelling to the Hotel by car there are 10 car parking spaces available which are allocated on a first come first serve basis. Alternatively there is a NCP carpark within walking distance.
